title.narrative: COMPREHENSIVE EDUCATION SPACES - GENDEREQUALITY

description.narrative: Children, adolescents, families and communities participate in the creation of comprehensive education spaces that promote gender equity and safe and protective school environments and contribute to quality education., which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development (Covid), Learning Outcomes, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2023, children and adolescents at the initial, primary and secondary levels and from excluded populations and populations vulnerable to climate change will have access to equitable, quality and pertinent education that effectively prepares them to integrate as active protagonists of their own development

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Children, adolescents, families and communities participate in the creation of comprehensive education spaces that promote gender equity and safe and protective school environments and contribute to quality education.

description.narrative: Children attending basic and secondary school enjoy a safer and more peaceful school environment as the community school has engaged in actions within and outside the school, promoting better peer, teachers and parents' relationships. Efforts has been made to promote tolerance, respect, care and self-awareness, to prevent social risk behaviors that may lead to school failure and eventual dropouts. Also, children have been provided with better quality extracurricular activities dealing with day to day issues, providing them with life skills that enable them to cope better with difficult situations such as violence in its various forms. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:24/01/2019
